New Records: Lockie Ferguson bowled four maidens, the second time in men's T20 Internationals a bowler has done so without conceding a run; New Zealand won the match by seven wickets;
Key Match Events: Rain delayed the start; New Zealand won the toss and chose to bowl first; Lockie Ferguson removed PNG captain Assad Vala with his first delivery; Ferguson ended with 3/0, a world record; Kabua Morea took 2/4; Devon Conway scored 35; New Zealand chase was completed with 46 balls to spare;
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand were ranked fifth in the world at the start of the tournament; both teams were playing their final match after missing qualification from Group C;
Post-Match Reflections: Lockie Ferguson earned the Aramco POTM Award; New Zealand's Finn Allen and Rachin Ravindra had cheap losses; PNG's Kabua Morea and Semo Kamea were key wicket-takers;
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the ICC Menâ€™s T20 World Cup 2024; it was the final group stage fixture for both teams; Trent Boult played his last appearance at a T20 World Cup;
Others: The game was played on 17 June 2024; the scorecard showed PNG scored 78 and New Zealand scored 79;
